column4: i am transfering files between a whole new ubuntu 10.10 install but the transfer is only 4mb/s running on 100mbps lan transfer is via sftp ... any idea why ?
Which transfer method? scp? sshfs? nfs? samba?
yes it 4 MB/s but it is still slow, you should reach around 8, sftp transfer
Maybe they are small files or one of the CPUs are already maxed?
After all.. scp/sftp is quite CPU intensive.
: 50% of cpu in use, and about small files they are around 5-10MB each
If it's a single core hyperthreaded CPU, then it might be maxed...
While I don't know the details.. On a N270 Atom (1.6GHz) I can copy at around 6MB/sec due to CPU speed limitations.
: this cpu is a less powerfull cpu than the N270, so even with samba i should only be able to copy at aroud 6 MB/s ?
Samba might be faster since it's actually lighter than sftp in resources.
: it is because i got problems with my smb.conf file -_-
On the flipside, sftp gurantees a proper file transfer, samba doesn't have such an offer I think.
: you mean there is a check of the file≈õ on sftp ?
Since all the files are encrypted before transfer, I would assume that the file can't be decrypted if the transfer went bad.
: thx a lot for the infos :)
: just checked where the files were it sftp is taking 50%cpu on my  core 2 duo 2.0GHz ... so i can understand it got problems on a atom like cpu
